title: can't figure out this font
content:
Hi friends,  
I’ve come fairly close to identifying this font, but that swirl in the letter ’e’ is throwing me off.  
Any thoughts of what it is?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Untitled-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603021453/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_34.jpg) | 22.93 KB |

 [‹ Please help me identify this font (Real Madrid new kit's font)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603021453/http:/typophile.com/node/45702 "Go to previous forum topic") [Need help with logo font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603021453/http:/typophile.com/node/45716 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bfactorgroup

comments.content:
It’s called Parma Petit, by Manfred Klein. It used to be sold by Alphabets\*inc, but now I think Manfred has released it as freeware/shareware. I think it’s at TypOasis under his designer page there.

- Mike Yanega

That was a tie Angel. I knew that one because it was one of the early fonts I bought, when I first got started collecting fonts back in 1993.

- Mike Yanega

That was definitely the font. Gee, you started collecting fonts in 93... what a year! I think Mosaic was the web browser of choice that year. That’s when I started learning the HTML realm. Thanks again for the assistance!

_“93... what a year!”,_

Indeed. Back when there weren’t over 100,000 fonts to try to learn. (I didn’t even have e-mail until late 1994, and I think it was years before I started learning about the web.)

Anyway, glad to help out.

- Mike Yanega
